intro: Navarretia linearis, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This annual herb is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Navarretia linearis typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its delicate appearance and short life cycle make it a notable species in ecological studies.
